lessons.title: Introduction to Algebra

content.introduction: Learn the basics of algebra - a fundamental branch of mathematics that uses variables and equations to solve problems.

topics.title: What is Algebra?
topics.content: Algebra is the mathematics of general numbers represented by letters (variables). It helps us solve problems where we don't know all the values.

topics.title: Variables and Constants
topics.content: A variable is a letter that represents an unknown number. A constant is a number that has a fixed value. In the expression 2x + 5, x is a variable and 2, 5 are constants.

topics.title: Writing Algebraic Expressions
topics.content: We can translate words into algebraic expressions: 'twice a number' becomes 2x, 'three more than a number' becomes x + 3, 'a number decreased by 7' becomes x - 7.

examples.problem: Write an algebraic expression for: 'Five less than a number'
examples.solution: Let x be the number. Five less than the number is x - 5.

examples.problem: Write an algebraic expression for: 'The sum of a number and 8'
examples.solution: Let x be the number. The sum of the number and 8 is x + 8.

key_points: Expressions combine variables, constants, and operations
Order of operations (PEMDAS/BODMAS) applies to algebraic expressions

lessons.title: Solving Linear Equations

content.introduction: Learn how to solve equations with one variable by performing inverse operations.

topics.title: One-Step Equations
topics.content: Addition/subtraction: To undo +3, subtract 3 from both sides. Multiplication/division: To undo ×2, divide both sides by 2.

topics.title: Two-Step Equations
topics.content: First undo addition/subtraction, then undo multiplication/division. Always work backwards from the answer.

topics.title: Multi-Step Equations
topics.content: Use distributive property if needed, combine like terms, then solve using inverse operations.

key_points: What you do to one side, you must do to the other
Use inverse operations to isolate the variable
Always check your solution by substituting back

content.introduction: Learn to expand and factor quadratic expressions - essential for solving quadratic equations.

topics.title: FOIL Method
topics.content: First, Outer, Inner, Last - multiply terms in each position when expanding (a+b)(c+d)

topics.title: Factoring Quadratics
topics.content: Find two numbers that multiply to give 'c' and add to give 'b' in ax² + bx + c

examples.solution: F: x·x = x², O: x·3 = 3x, I: 2·x = 2x, L: 2·3 = 6. Result: x² + 5x + 6
Find two numbers: 2 and 3 (multiply to 6, add to 5). Result: (x + 2)(x + 3)

content.introduction: Learn to translate real-world situations into equations and solve them.

topics.title: Steps to Solve Word Problems
topics.content: 1) Read carefully and identify what you're looking for. 2) Define variables. 3) Set up equation. 4) Solve. 5) Check if answer makes sense.

topics.title: Common Problem Types
topics.content: Age problems, distance/rate/time problems, mixture problems, number problems

examples.problem: A rectangle has length 3 more than its width. If the perimeter is 26, find the dimensions.
examples.solution: Let w = width, then l = w + 3. Perimeter = 2l + 2w = 26. 2(w+3) + 2w = 26. 4w + 6 = 26. 4w = 20. w = 5, l = 8

content.introduction: Learn to solve problems with multiple equations and multiple unknowns.

topics.title: Substitution Method
topics.content: Solve one equation for a variable, substitute into the other equation.

topics.title: Elimination Method
topics.content: Multiply equations to make coefficients equal, then add or subtract to eliminate a variable.

examples.solution: Add equations: 3x = 9, so x = 3. Substitute: 3 + y = 5, so y = 2
